newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - January 31.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - January 31.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - U.S. attacks communist China's record of serious violations of human rights.
Taiwan to recruit 4,000 people to take part in police service.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Minister without portfolio Ma Ying-jeou to run for Taipei mayor on Nationalist Party slate.
Taiwan to intensify organised crime crackdown ahead of Chinese lunar new year.
LIBERTY TIMES - Seven South Korean environmentalists "pursuaded" to leave Taiwan.
Some 80 people involved in gambling scandal in professional baseball games.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong says monetary policy remains unchanged.
Taiwan, USA reach consensus on commercial harbour construction fees.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Seven private companies win eight paging system licences.
Central bank to continue to adopt stable-to-loose monetary policy.
